Name: Canada
Notes: This is the first McDonald's outside of the United States. See McDonald's Canada

Name: Puerto Rico
Notes: First McDonald's in Latin America and in the Caribbean. See McDonald's Puerto Rico

Name: Costa Rica
First_location: San José, 4th street, between 1st and Central Avenue.
Notes: Third country (not U.S. possession) and first outlet outside Northern America where McDonald's opened. See McDonald's Costa Rica

Name: Australia
Notes: First outlet in Oceania and first outlet outside the Americas. See McDonald's Australia. Locally known as Maccas.

Name: Japan
Notes: First outlet in Asia, see McDonald's Japan; McDonald's Holdings Company Japan, Inc.[10] locally known as makku (<U+30DE><U+30C3><U+30AF>). The most McDonald's in a country out of the United States

Name: Netherlands
Notes: This was the first outlet in Europe. Opened in 1971 by European Master Franchisees Jan Sybesma McDonald's Europe – Plan to open 15 more stores in the next 4 years. See McDonald's Netherlands

Name: Germany
Notes: First outlet in West Germany opened in Munich-Obergiesing in 1971. McDonald's is locally known as Megges. First outlet in the new states of Germany opened in Plauen in 1990 following reunification.

Name: France
Notes: First outlet in Creteil in 1972 even though McDonald's officially recognizes the first outlet in Strasbourg in 1979. See McDonald's France.

Name: El Salvador
Notes: Many restaurants were Bombed in the 80s by the Salvadoran Guerilla But the Chain maintained Operations In the Country.

Name: Sweden
Notes: First outlet in Scandinavia. See McDonald's Sweden

Name: United Kingdom
First_opened: England: November 13, 1974[17]Wales: December 3, 1984Scotland: November 23, 1987[18]Northern Ireland: October 12, 1991
Notes: Includes Isle of Man and Jersey (1 each)England: 1,038Scotland: 95Wales: 62Northern Ireland: 26See McDonald's UK

Name: Hong Kong
First_location: Paterson Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island.[19]
Notes: First outlet in a Chinese-speaking territory. Hong Kong was then a British Crown colony/Dependent Territory; McDonald's would open up a restaurant in China itself 15 years later. See McDonald's Hong Kong.

Name: Bahamas
Notes: First outlet in an independent country of the Caribbean.

Name: New Zealand
Notes: Founded in New Zealand by Wally and Hugh Morris[21]First South Island restaurants opened at Linwood and Merivale, both Christchurch, on 3 November 1987.[22] See McDonald's New Zealand.

Name: Ireland
Notes: First drive-thru in Europe opened in Nutgrove, Dublin and first McCafé in Europe Grafton Street, Dublin, see McDonald's Ireland

Name: Brazil
Notes: First outlet in South America and first outlet in a lusophone country. See McDonald's Brazil

Name: Singapore
Notes: First outlet in Southeast Asia. See McDonald's Singapore All Singaporean McDonald's locations are certified <U+1E25>alal.[24]

Name: Spain
Notes: First outlet in the Iberian Peninsula, see McDonald's Spain

Name: Malaysia
Notes: Oldest surviving outlet in a Muslim-majority country. See McDonald's Malaysia

Name: Taiwan
Notes: All restaurants were temporarily closed in 1992 during investigations of restaurant bombings in Taiwan; they reopened after investigations had concluded.See McDonald's Taiwan

Name: Cuba
Notes: Guantanamo Bay; open only to military personnel. Not accessible for Cuban citizens.

Name: Turkey
Notes: First outlet opened in East Thrace; outlets in Anatolia would open later. Also first outlet in the Turkic-speaking world, with Azerbaijan coming second at 1999. See McDonald's Turkey

Name: Macau
First_location: Rua do Campo, Cathedral Parish, Macau Peninsula
Notes: Then Portuguese territory; McDonald's would only open a restaurant in Portugal itself 4 years later. see List of restaurants.

Name: Serbia
Notes: First outlet in a communist country (not communist anymore) and first outlet in the Balkans. See McDonald's Serbia

Name: Hungary
Notes: Second communist country, first Warsaw Pact member, thus first outlet behind the Iron Curtain. Locally known as Meki. See McDonald's Hungary

Name: Russia
Notes: First outlet in the Soviet Union itself, which then disintegrated 23 months after its opening. See [2]

Name: Indonesia
Notes: First branch in Sarinah closed 2020 due to refurbishment of Sarinah itself.[33] See McDonald's Indonesia

Name: Czech Republic
Notes: First McDonald's outlet to open after the Cold War. See McDonald's Czech Republic

Name: Poland
First_location: Marszalkowska Street, Warsaw in department store "Sezam"

Name: Morocco
Notes: First outlet in Africa and the first outlet in the Arab World; McDonald's is now present in all continents except Antarctica. See McDonald's Morocco

Name: Northern Marianas
Notes: First outlet opened on the island of Saipan; second outlet opened in 1997

Name: Israel
Notes: First outlet in the Middle East. See McDonald's Israel

Name: Saudi Arabia
Notes: First outlet in the Arabian Peninsula. See McDonald's Saudi Arabia McDonald's Saudi Arabia

Name: Latvia
Notes: First outlet in the Baltics. See McDonald's Latvia

Name: South Africa
Notes: First outlet in Southern Africa. See McDonald's South Africa

Name: Fiji
Notes: As of April 2012, Fiji was the only country in the world to still use the 2003 "i'm lovin' it" packaging, even though the other countries are using the 2008 packaging for meals and items. See McDonald's Fiji

Name: India
Notes: First outlet in South Asia. See McDonald's India

Name: Dominican Republic
Notes: Country with the second most locations of McDonald's in the Caribbean, after Puerto Rico. See McDonald's Dominican Republic

Name: Belarus
Notes:
First McDonald's in a non-Baltic former Soviet republic (not including Russia)
The company claimed this as McDonald's "100th country" although this calculation included many non-sovereign territories. See McDonald's Belarus.

Name: Trinidad and Tobago
Notes: McDonald's previously had stores in Trinidad (May 6, 1997 – October 25, 2003) but closed due to low sales. Re-opened at The Falls at West Mall in 2011 and has expanded to 5 other locations.[42]

Name: Ukraine
Notes: All three restaurants in the peninsula of Crimea were closed in 2014. See McDonald's Ukraine

Name: Nicaragua
Notes: McDonald's outlets ceased operation during the Nicaraguan Civil War and re-established a presence in 1998 after an absence of two decades. During the civil war one continued operating as "Donald's".[43] See McDonald's Nicaragua

Name: Lebanon
Notes: See McDelivery Lebanon, which is currently merged with its official website as local franchisee Miknas Food S.A.L. is gradually reforming their McDonald's store chain

Name: Georgia
Notes: First outlet in the Caucasus. See McDonald's Georgia

Name: Iraq
Notes: One location in Baghdad for the U.S. Army, but there is also a knockoff called MaDonal.

Name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
Notes: After some 10 years of trying to enter the Bosnian market with no success, McDonald's opened its first restaurant in Bosnia on 20 July 2011. See McDonald's Bosnia and Herzegovina

Name: Kazakhstan
Notes: First outlet in Central Asia. See McDonald's Kazakhstan
